item.title: Elon Musk is getting serious about orbital data centers
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: We’re starting to see the idea of Musk-owned orbital AI data clusters cohere into an actual plan.

item.title: NASA astronauts can now bring their phones with them on their mission to the moon
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Get ready for some selfies that are out of this world. Crew-12 is expected to head to the International Space Station next week, while the highly anticipated Artemis II mission -- which will bring humans around the moon for the first time since the 1960s -- was delayed until March.

item.title: OpenAI launches a way for enterprises to build and manage AI agents
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: OpenAI launched Frontier, a new platform designed for enterprises to build and deploy agents while treating them like human employees.

item.title: Anthropic releases Opus 4.6 with new ‘agent teams’
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The newest version of Anthropic's model is designed to broaden its appeal.

item.title: Secondary sales shift from founder windfalls to employee-retention tools
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: AI startups like Clay and ElevenLabs are using early liquidity to keep their best talent.

item.title: Meta tests a standalone app for its AI-generated ‘Vibes’ videos
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Launched last September, Vibes lets you create and share short-form AI-generated videos and access a dedicated feed that displays AI videos from others.

item.title: Pacific Fusion finds a cheaper way to make its fusion reactor work
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The fusion power startup recently completed some experiments at Sandia National Laboratory's Z Machine and shared the results exclusively with TechCrunch.

item.title: Trump’s critical mineral reserve is an admission that the future is electric
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The administration's $12 billion stockpile of critical minerals is aimed at blunting China's influence. But it also revels the direction of the global economy.

item.title: Data breach at govtech giant Conduent balloons, affecting millions more Americans
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The ransomware attack at Conduent allowed hackers to steal a "significant number of individuals’ personal information" from the govtech giant's systems. Conduent handles personal and health data of more than 100 million people across America.

item.title: Fundamental raises $255 million Series A with a new take on big data analysis
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: Fundamental has built a new foundation model to solve an old problem: how to draw insights from the huge quantities of structured data produced by enterprises.

item.title: Substack confirms data breach affects users’ email addresses and phone numbers
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Substack said that customer data was accessed in October 2025, but wasn't discovered until early February.

item.title: ElevenLabs CEO: Voice is the next interface for AI
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: ElevenLabs CEO argued at Web Summit Qatar that voice is the next interface for AI, as OpenAI, Google, and Apple push conversational systems into wearables, new hardware, and everyday interactions.

item.title: Google’s subscriptions rise in Q4 as YouTube pulls $60B in yearly revenue
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The company said it now has 325 million paying users across Google One and YouTube Premium, up from 300 million users three months earlier.

item.title: Spotify ventures into physical book sales, adds new audiobook features
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Spotify users in the U.S. and the UK will soon be able to buy physical books in the app. There's also a new tool that syncs physical books to audiobooks.

item.title: Sam Altman got exceptionally testy over Claude Super Bowl ads
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: He posted a novella-sized rant that devolved into to calling his rival "dishonest" and "authoritarian."

item.title: As it preps Specs for the masses, Snap’s Q4 shows revenue growth but fewer daily users
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The company is engaged in a strategy to diversify its revenue sources as it heads into the new year.

item.title: Mundi Ventures closes on €750M for Kembara, its largest deep tech and climate fund
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Spain-based deeptech and climate megafund Kembara has just completed a €750 million first close toward its €1 billion target.

item.title: Stripe alumni raise €30M Series A for Duna, backed by Stripe and Adyen execs
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Having raised a €30 million Series A round led by CapitalG, business identity verification startup Duna is now among the most well-capitalized European startups founded by Stripe alumni.

item.title: Alphabet won’t talk about the Google-Apple AI deal, even to investors
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Alphabet CEO skipped an analyst's question about Apple on the company's earnings call.

item.title: Google’s Gemini app has surpassed 750M monthly active users
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Google revealed a significant milestone for its Gemini app, announcing over 750 million monthly active users as it competes with ChatGPT and Meta AI.
